required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Chidamide Plus Sintilimab for Chemotherapy-refractory Advanced High-grade Neuroendocrine Neoplasm
clinical_study.official_title: Chidamide and Sintilimab for Chemotherapy-refractory Advanced High-grade Neuroendocrine Neoplasm: a Prospective, Single-arm, Multicenter, Phase 2 Clinical Study

collaborator.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of Xiamen University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to explore the efficacy and safety of chidamide combined with sintilimab in chemotherapy-refractory advanced high-grade neuroendocrine neoplasm.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a single-arm, multi-center, two-stage, phase II clinical trial conducted in China. This study adopts Simon's two-stage design, and the inclusion criteria and exclusion criteria of the two stages were consistent. Six patients with high-grade neuroendocrine neoplasm will be enrolled in the first stage. If more than one complete or partial responses were seen at planned interim analysis, the additional 17 patients will be recruited in the second stage and a total of 23 patients will be treated.

primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with complete response and partial response, assessed by the investigators according to the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST), version 1.1

secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with complete response, partial response, and stable disease assessed by the investigators according to the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST), version 1.1

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from the date of enrollment to the earliest of documented disease progression or death, assessed up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Time from the date of enrollment until progression or death, whichever is first met

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from the date of enrollment to the earliest of documented death, assessed up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Time from the date of enrollment until death
Frequency and grade of adverse events (the grade of adverse events is assessed according to CTCAE v4.03)

arm_group.description: Experimental arm will be treated by chidamide combined with sintilimab for up to 24 months.

intervention.description: 30mg; administered orally; twice a week (d1, d4, d8, d11, d15, d18). Repeat every 3 weeks for up to 24 months.
200mg; intravenous infusion; d1. Repeat every 3 weeks for up to 24 months.

facility.name: The First Affiliated Hospital of Xiamen University

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual participant data are not available to others.
